abstract:
A key question regarding the future of the semantic web is “how will we acquire structured information to populate the semantic
web on a vast scale?” One approach is to enter this information manually. A second approach is to take advantage of pre-existing
databases, and to develop common ontologies, publishing standards, and reward systems to make this data widely accessible.
We consider here a third approach: developing software that automatically extracts structured information from unstructured
text present on the web. We also describe preliminary results demonstrating that machine learning algorithms can learn to
extract tens of thousands of facts to populate a diverse ontology, with imperfect but reasonably good accuracy.
